pages.text: The noble metal hypothesis has proven to be true and I was able to get some results from my observations and experiments.$(br)Most importantly, a rock thrown into an excess of the tear fluid has almost instantly turned into a handful of sludge.
Unfortunately, this sludge seems rather mundane. There might be a way to polish it up, but I wonder if more exotic materials can yield more promising results?$(br2)

One thing that this experiment has shown is that touching the fluid is $(o)unimaginably painful$().$(br2)I probably need a more controllable way of studying tear interactions, not just throwing stuff into a crucible.$(br2)todo: infusion table...
